page.title: 05Sheep in rural Sowerby
page.content: Only two of the farmers in our block had a significant number of sheep. One had a flock of 120 Suffolk Cross which are bought in in October and sold after about six months. They are fattened off grass with arable waste in winter i.e. sugar beet tops, potatoes, and sugar beet pulp. Another farmer carries 80 ewes, the lambs from which are also fattened and sold for meat at 38 kilos at about Â£1.25 per kilo. The farmer's wife keeps about 5 Jacob's ewes and breeds from them with a Suffolk tup to get black lambs, which again go on to the meat market.An acre of grass supports 5 ewes.
